config.question: For most of their early history, the colonies of Maryland and Virginia __________.

choices.content: contained far more men than women
provided a healthy environment for child rearing
had harsh laws punishing premarital sexual relations
encouraged the formation of stable and long-lasting marriages

answer_3.response: Because of the unbalanced sex ratio, many adult males could not find wives. Migration not only cut them off from their English families but also deprived them of an opportunity to form new ones.
